name: Pancakes
steps: In a bowl, mix the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Add the milk, eggs, and melted butter. Stir until smooth.
Heat a non-stick pan and pour 1/4 cup batter for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown.

name: Spaghetti Bolognese
steps: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté onion and garlic until softened.
Add ground beef and cook until browned.
Stir in tomato sauce, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15 minutes.
Serve the sauce over the cooked spaghetti.

name: Panini
steps: Slice the ciabatta rolls in half.
Spread pesto sauce on the inside of each roll.
Layer turkey, provolone cheese, and roasted red peppers on the bottom half of each roll.
Top with the other half of the roll.
Brush the outside of each sandwich with olive oil.
Grill the panini on a preheated panini press or skillet until the bread is golden and the cheese is melted.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a bowl, whisk together flour and baking soda.
In another bowl, mix melted butter, sugar, and brown sugar until smooth.
Add vanilla extract and eggs, then stir in flour mixture until combined.
Fold in chocolate chips.
Drop spoonfuls of dough onto a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes until golden brown.

name: Dumplings
ingredients: Soy sauce and vinegar for dipping
steps: In a bowl, combine ground pork, cabbage, green onions, soy sauce, and sesame oil.
Place a small spoonful of the filling in the center of each dumpling wrapper.
Moisten the edges of the wrapper with water and fold to seal, forming a pleated edge.
Steam or boil the dumplings until cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
Serve with a dipping sauce made from soy sauce and vinegar.

name: Mango Sticky Rice
steps: Rinse the rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
In a pot, combine the rice and water. Cook over medium heat until the water is absorbed.
In a separate pan, heat coconut milk, sugar, and salt until the sugar dissolves.
Pour half of the coconut milk mixture over the cooked rice and let it absorb.
Serve the rice with sliced mangoes on top and drizzle with the remaining coconut milk.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds if desired.
